Package it.polimi.ingsw.client.view.gui.scene.gamecomponents

Class CharacterListManager

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.client.view.gui.scene.gamecomponents.CharacterListManager
public class CharacterListManager extends Object
Layout manager for the list of available characters

  • Constructor Details

    • CharacterListManager

      public CharacterListManager(javafx.scene.layout.Pane characterListPane, javafx.beans.binding.ListExpression<Character> characterList, javafx.beans.binding.IntegerExpression myCoins, javafx.beans.binding.BooleanExpression isInteractive, BiConsumer<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent,Character> clickHandler)
      Creates a new instance with the new parameters
      Parameters:
      characterListPane - the Pane in which content will be injected
      characterList - a ListExpression containing the list of characters to represent
      myCoins - a IntegerExpression containing the coins of the player on this client
      isInteractive - a BooleanExpression indicating whether the layout should be interactive
      clickHandler - a click handler for when a character has been clicked
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any parameter is null

  • Method Details

    • startManaging

      public void startManaging()
      Start reactively managing the layout.

      Note: the absence of a stopManaging() here is intentional. The lifecycle of each GameState object is as long as that of its view. Therefore, we have to worry only about internal cleanup between relayouts.

    • layout

      private void layout(javafx.collections.ObservableList<? extends Character> characters)
      Cleans the slate and injects up-to-date content into the root pane.
      Parameters:
      characters - the character list
